pages.text: Yinlong is a basal ceratopsian described from the Shishugou Formation, Xinjiang, China. Known from a whole preserved body, it was small bipedal herbivore, and did not have any horns or frills. Considering gastroliths, it probably had a diet close to other early ceratopsians such as Psittacosaurus.
